page.title: 20WILDLIFE ON SCORAIG
page.content: BECAUSE OF ITS WINDSWEPT POSITION BETWEEN 2 ARMS OF THE SEA,SCORAIG HAD VERY FEW TREES AND SUPPORTED THE KIND OF WILDLIFE USUALLY FOUND ON MOORLAND AND ROCKY SHORE.IN THE LAST 40 yrs THOUSANDS OF TREES WERE PLANTED. THIS HAS CHANGED THE ENVIRONMENT ROUND THE CROFTS.HEDGEHOGS HAVE BEEN INTRODUCED AND THERE IS A GREATER VARIETY OF SMALL BIRDS.THERE ARE FEWER STARLINGS AND,BECAUSE OF THE INCREASED HUMAN POPULATION,BUZZARDS AND OTHER BIRDS OF PREY ARE LESS EVIDENT.FEW PESTICIDES OR CHEMICAL FERTILISERS ARE USED ON SCORAIG.RED DEER WERE A PROBLEM TO CROFTERS.THEY USED TO BREAK IN.THEN A DEER FENCE WAS BUILT ACROSS THE PENIN- SULA ABOUT 250m FROM THE TOP OF THE HIGHEST CROFT.THE POPULATION OF RABBIT DROPPED SINCE MYXOMATOSIS.WILDCATS AND FOXES ENDANGER POULTRY AND LAMBS.
